org.rakiura.cpn
Class XMLSerializer

java.lang.Object
  org.rakiura.cpn.NetVisitorAdapter
      org.rakiura.cpn.XMLSerializer
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, NetVisitor
public final class XMLSerializer
extends NetVisitorAdapter

Class that arranges saving a JFERN net to XML. Utility class. A net can be saved to an XML document, stream or file.

Since:
3.0
Version:
4.1.0 $Revision: 1.26 $
Author:
Mariusz Nowostawski, Martin Fleurke
See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

writeXML

public static final void writeXML(Net aNet,
                                  java.io.File anOutputfile)
                           throws java.io.IOException
Dumps a given collection of net elements into a specified file as XML.

Parameters:
aNet - the net to process to XML
anOutputfile - output file
Throws:
java.io.IOException - when something goes wrong with I/O.

writeXML

public static final void writeXML(Net aNet,
                                  java.io.OutputStream anOut)
                           throws java.io.IOException
Dumps a given collection of net elements into a specified stream as XML. The stream will be flushed and closed.

Parameters:
aNet - the net to process to XML
anOut - an OutputStream to put it in.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - when something goes wrong with I/O.

buildXML

public static final org.w3c.dom.Document buildXML(Net net)
Utility method to generate XML document out of a Net. Note: all the IDs of net elements are taken directly from net elements, only the IDs for annotations are generated automatically by this serializer.

Parameters:
net - the net to create the Document for
Returns:
the docment representing the net.

arrayToString

public static java.lang.String arrayToString(java.lang.String[] array)
concatenates the strings in the array with comma's.

Parameters:
array - an array of strings to be concatenated
Returns:
the contents of the array in one string with comma's between the different parts.

stringToArray

public static java.lang.String[] stringToArray(java.lang.String string)
Divides a string into substrings. Division is done on the places where a ',' is found. The comma is not included in the output.

Parameters:
string - the string to divide and to put in an array of substrings
Returns:
an array of substrings.
